item.title: Profisee Added as CVE Numbering Authority (CNA)
item.description: Profisee Added as CVE Numbering Authority (CNA)newsJune 10, 2025Profisee Group, Inc., is now aCVE Numbering Authority (CNA)for vulnerabilities found in software developed by Profisee only.

item.title: OpenJS Foundation Added as CVE Numbering Authority (CNA)
item.description: OpenJS Foundation Added as CVE Numbering Authority (CNA)newsJune 10, 2025OpenJS Foundationis now aCVE Numbering Authority (CNA)for all projects listed athttps://openjsf.org/projects.

item.title: “CVE List Keyword Search” on CVE.ORG Website Updated
item.description: “CVE List Keyword Search” on CVE.ORG Website UpdatedblogBy CVE Program|June 11, 2025“CVE List Keyword Search” on the CVE.ORG has been updated based upon feedback back from users. As a reminder, this search is for the CVE List only. It will only searchCVE Records. To search the overall website, use the “Site Search” located to the right of the CVE List search box above.

item.title: Videos fromCVE/FIRST VulnCon 2025Now Available
item.description: Videos fromCVE/FIRST VulnCon 2025Now AvailableblogBy CVE Program|June 17, 2025Videos of eighty-nine sessions fromCVE/FIRST VulnCon 2025are now available on theFIRST Channel on YouTubeand theCVE Program Channel on YouTube. The purpose of VulnCon is to collaborate with various vulnerability management and cybersecurity professionals to develop forward leaning ideas that can be taken back to individual programs for action to benefit the vulnerability management ecosystem.

item.title: Minutes from CVE Board Teleconference Meeting on May 28 Now Available
item.description: Minutes from CVE Board Teleconference Meeting on May 28 Now AvailablenewsJune 17, 2025TheCVE Boardheld a teleconference meeting on May 28, 2025. Read themeeting minutes summary.

item.title: Toreon Added as CVE Numbering Authority (CNA)
item.description: Toreon Added as CVE Numbering Authority (CNA)newsJune 17, 2025Toreonis now aCVE Numbering Authority (CNA)for vulnerabilities discovered by or reported to Toreon that are not in another CNA’s scope.

item.title: CVE Program Adds “Researcher Working Group” for Researcher and Bug Bounty CNAs
item.description: CVE Program Adds “Researcher Working Group” for Researcher and Bug Bounty CNAsnewsJuly 1, 2025The CVE Program has added a new working group (WG), theResearcher Working Group (RWG), with the purpose of giving voice to, and establishing working norms for, the extended community of designated ResearcherCVE Numbering Authorities (CNAs). This includes providing guidance and advice to the research community, as well as other research community activities designed to promote the CVE Program.

item.title: New “CVE Consumer Working Group” Open to the Public
item.description: New “CVE Consumer Working Group” Open to the PublicnewsJuly 1, 2025The CVE Program’s newest public working group (WG), theCVE Consumer Working Group (CWG), will serve as a dedicated forum for representing the perspectives of end-consumers ofCVE Listdata, such as enterprises, security teams, vulnerability analysts, government agencies, managed security service providers (MSSPs), academic researchers, software vendors and tool developers who rely on CVE data to support decision-making, operational defense, and risk management. The CWG will identify consumer needs, evaluate the usability of CVE data, and recommend improvements to ensure that the CVE Program remains aligned with real-world use cases.

item.title: Maritime Hacking Village Added as CVE Numbering Authority (CNA)
item.description: Maritime Hacking Village Added as CVE Numbering Authority (CNA)newsJuly 1, 2025Maritime Hacking Villageis now aCVE Numbering Authority (CNA)for vulnerabilities discovered by researchers in collaboration with Maritime Hacking Village that are not in another CNA’s scope.

item.title: Fermax Added as CVE Numbering Authority (CNA)
item.description: Fermax Added as CVE Numbering Authority (CNA)newsJuly 1, 2025Fermax Technologies SLUis now aCVE Numbering Authority (CNA)for vulnerabilities discovered in the services and applications of the MeetMe and DuoxMe products that are not covered by another CNA’s scope.
